Yes, there are some controversial takes on modernizing Celtic music. Some traditionalists argue that modernizing Celtic music takes away from its cultural and historical significance. They believe that modernizing Celtic music turns it into a commercialized product, which takes away from the original beauty and meaning of the music. 

Others argue that modernizing Celtic music helps keep the sound alive and relevant to younger generations. They believe that modernizing Celtic music allows it to reach a wider audience and can even help preserve its original sound by keeping it relevant.

In addition, there are also debates around cultural appropriation in modernizing Celtic music. Some argue that modern artists who take elements of Celtic music and combine it with other genres are appropriating and profiting off of a culture that is not their own. Others argue that music is a universal language and that it is important for different cultures to share and celebrate each other's music.

Overall, modernizing Celtic music can be a controversial topic with different opinions and perspectives.
